comment.author: 21647809@N04
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/27331537@N06] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/jimmcgs] Judging from thew clothing I'd say this shot is pre-World War 2, as a lad growing up less than a kilometer from the site I don't recall the shed on the esplanade in the 1950s. You'll also the note that the surfboards are 'longboards', the surfboard we know today being introduced after the war. Viewers will also note the prime condition of the Norfolk Island pine trees (compare to Beachcomber's photo) and the skyline which has changed dramatically over the last seventy five years.

comment.author: 59513278@N04
comment._content: It has changed quite dramatically. Don't know what I was thinking. Many of these beach pavilions were built by the same company and some of them do look similar. I probably have it mixed up with another beach
